intro: Plagiogyria japonica, commonly known as the Japanese plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, greenish-white inflorescences, which bloom in early spring. Plagiogyria japonica is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and is often used in traditional herbal medicine in East Asia.
